sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"游行"之意。
means: parade ： 多指盛大和正式的游行，有检阅等活动。
demonstration ： 侧重指抗议的示威性游行。
procession ： 指举行庆祝活动或盛大仪式时庄严行进的有秩序的游行队伍或行列。

sentence.Network_en: Morning parade was in progress on the parade ground.
sentence.Network_cn: 阅兵场正在进行早间检阅。

sentence.Network_en: A military parade marched slowly and solemnly down Pennsylvania Avenue.
sentence.Network_cn: 阅兵队列沿宾夕法尼亚大道缓慢而庄严地行进。

sentence.Network_en: People stood waiting for the kick-off of the parade.
sentence.Network_cn: 人们站着等候游行的开始。

derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: from French, literally a showing', from Spanish parada and Italian parata, based on Latin parare 'prepare, furnish'

entry.tran: （庆祝重大日子或事件的）游行行列
entry.def: A parade is a procession of people or vehicles moving through a public place in order to celebrate an important day or event.

example.ex: A military parade marched slowly and solemnly down Pennsylvania Avenue.
example.tran: 阅兵队列沿宾夕法尼亚大道缓慢而庄严地行进。

entry.def: When people parade somewhere, they walk together in a formal group or a line, usually with other people watching them.

example.ex: More than four thousand soldiers, sailors and airmen paraded down the Champs Elysee...
example.tran: 逾4,000名陆、海、空三军将士在香榭丽舍大街游行。

example.ex: Everybody was beginning to parade back to the village.
example.tran: 大家开始成群结队地返回村庄。

entry.def: Parade is a formal occasion when soldiers stand in lines to be seen by an officer or important person, or march in a group.

example.ex: He had them on parade at six o'clock in the morning...
example.tran: 他让他们早晨6点列队接受检阅。

example.ex: Morning parade was in progress on the parade ground.
example.tran: 阅兵场正在进行早间检阅。

entry.def: If flags or statues are paraded, they are carried in a procession.

example.ex: Banners were paraded from church to church on feast days.
example.tran: 宗教节日期间，人们打着横幅在教堂间游行。

entry.tran: 将（囚犯）游街；将（囚犯）示众
entry.def: If prisoners are paraded through the streets of a town or on television, they are shown to the public, usually in order to make the people who are holding them seem more powerful or important.

example.ex: Five leading fighter pilots have been captured and paraded before the media.
example.tran: 有5名一流的战斗机飞行员被俘，并被在媒体上曝光。

entry.def: If you say that someone parades a person, you mean that they show that person to others only in order to gain some advantage for themselves.

example.ex: Children are paraded on television alongside the party leaders to win votes.
example.tran: 为了拉选票，孩子们被拉去和政党领袖们一起出现在电视上。

entry.def: If people parade something, they show it in public so that it can be admired.

example.ex: Valentino is keen to see celebrities parading his clothes at big occasions.
example.tran: 瓦伦蒂诺喜欢看名人在重大场合展示他设计的服装。

entry.def: If someone parades, they walk about somewhere in order to be seen and admired.

example.ex: I love to put on a bathing suit and parade on the beach...
example.tran: 我喜欢穿着泳衣在海滩上招摇而行。

entry.def: If someone parades a real or pretended feeling or quality, they draw attention to themselves by displaying it.

example.ex: They parade their virtuous beliefs and hide their vices...
example.tran: 他们大秀美德并掩盖自己的罪恶。

example.ex: Women were not supposed to parade their ambition nakedly.
example.tran: 女性被认为不应该赤裸裸地展示其雄心。

entry.def: If you say that something parades as or is paraded as a good or important thing, you mean that some people say that it is good or important but you think it probably is not.

example.ex: The Chancellor will be able to parade his cut in interest rates as a small victory...
example.tran: 财政大臣就能把他的减息举措当作一场小胜来夸耀了。

example.ex: She might have been paraded as a woman who was working hard to change her ways.
example.tran: 她可能已经被吹嘘成一个靠努力工作改变命运的女人了。

entry.tran: （多得似乎没有尽头的）一系列
entry.def: If you talk about a parade of people or things, you mean that there is a series of them that seems never to end.

example.ex: When I ask Nick about his childhood, he remembers a parade of babysitters.
example.tran: 我问到尼克的童年生活时，他记起了一个又一个保姆。

entry.tran: （常指远离大街的）一小排店铺
entry.def: A parade is a short row of shops, usually set back from the main street.
Parade is used as part of the name of a street.

example.tran: 南海克拉伦斯商业街皇后酒店

means.word_mean: 1. a ceremonial procession including people marching
2. an extended (often showy) succession of persons or things;

sentences.sentence: "a parade of strollers on the mall"
"she made a parade of her sorrows"
"She parades her new husband around town"

list.explanation: 使某人扫兴，破坏某人的事(如表演、机遇等)

example.en: She really rained on our parade.
I hate to rain on your parade,but your plans are all wrong.
example.zh: 我不愿扫你的兴，但你的计划全都不对。 、

auth_sentence.res_content: I work nearby and decided to watch the parade.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I work nearby and decided to watch the parade.

auth_sentence.content: Members of the Krewe of Bacchus parade down St.
auth_sentence.res_content: Members of the Krewe of Bacchus parade down St.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Members of the Krewe of Bacchus parade down St.

auth_sentence.content: Girls in traditional dress parade during the Songkran festival.
auth_sentence.res_content: Girls in traditional dress parade during the Songkran festival.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Girls in traditional dress parade during the Songkran festival.

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. =bring birth,表示"生产,生出小孩"; 2. =come in sight,表示"看见;出现"; 3. =get ready,表示"准备;安置"; 4. =equal,表示"平等"

stems_affixes.value_cn: 一胎多子的, 经产的, 非初产的, [植]多产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: multi多+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→多生产的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 初产的, 初次分娩的
stems_affixes.word_buile: primi=prim第一,最初+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→adj.初产的, 初次分娩的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 每次产一个卵的; 每胎生一子的
stems_affixes.word_buile: uni单一+par生产,生出小孩+ous……的→生出一个

stems_affixes.value_cn: 表面上的,貌似真实的;显然的,明明白白的
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap一再+par看见;出现+ent……的→一再能看见→显而易见
trans横穿+par看见;出现+ent……的→横穿过去看得一样清楚→透明的
in不+separable[adj.可分离的, 可分的]→adj.不能分的
se分离+par置+able……的→adj.可分离的, 可分的
se分离+par置+ate表形容词→adj.分开的, 分离的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的
stems_affixes.word_buile: un无+prepare准备+ed……的→adj.无准备的, 即席的, 尚未准备好的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 可比较的, 比得上的
stems_affixes.word_buile: compare比较+able……的→adj.可比较的, 比得上的
compare比较+ative表形容词→adj.比较的, 相当的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 奇数的,不成对的,不平等
stems_affixes.word_buile: im不+parity[n.同等;奇偶]→adj.奇数的,不成对的,不平等
non不,无+par平等+eil→无平等的→无与伦比的
apparent显然的+ly表副词→adv.显然地
separate分开+ly表副词→adv.个别地;分离地
comparative[adj.比较的, 相当的]+ly表副词→adv.比较地, 相当地
par生产,生出小孩+ent……人→n.父母,母亲;[n.]双亲;父母

stems_affixes.value_cn: 透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃
stems_affixes.word_buile: transparent[[adj.透明的]]→n.透明, 透明度, 幻灯片, 有图案的玻璃

stems_affixes.value_cn: 器械,器具,仪器;机构,组织
stems_affixes.word_buile: ap=ad+par准备;安置+atus表名词→准备好用的东西→设备
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
prepare准备+ation行为,过程→n.准备, 预备
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com一起+pari=par平等+son→一起平等→比较
dis不+parity同等→n.不同,差异
par平等→n.一对, 一双
par平等+ity表名词→n.同等;奇偶
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
par准备;安置+ade表名词→本为部队训练场[即准备打仗得地方],引申为排队游行
pre预先+par准备;安置+e→预先准备好
re再+pair=par准备;安置→重新准备好→修理
com共同+par平等+e→平等的放在一起→比较
dis不+par平等+age动词后缀→不平等对待→轻视

Sentence.sentence: But chariots maintained their place in parades and triumphs right up until the end of the Roman Empire 1,500 years later.

sentences.en: The army paraded round drill squares.
sentences.cn: 军队绕训练场列队行进。

sentences.en: The Olympic Games began with a parade of all the competing nations.
sentences.cn: 奥运会以所有参赛国列队进场开始。

jushi.english: She paraded up and down in her new hat.
jushi.chinese: 她戴着新帽子招摇过市。

jushi.english: An army of penguins paraded along the beach.
jushi.chinese: 一群企鹅沿海滨列队行进。
